text: John Elwood "Bud" Clark, Jr. (December 19, 1931 - February 1, 2022) was an American politician and businessman. He served as Mayor of Portland, Oregon, from 1985 to 1992. A leftist populist with little political experience before his mayoral bid, he was one of Portland's most colorful political figures. Clark died on February 1, 2022 in Portland, Oregon from congestive heart failure, aged 90.Former Portland Mayor Bud Clark Dies at 90 ==References== Category:1931 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Mayors of Portland, Oregon Category:Politicians from Idaho Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:Businesspeople from Portland, Oregon Category:Businesspeople from Idaho Category:American political activists Category:Deaths from congestive heart failure
